Ashik wrote:
> Hi all,
> 
> We need to develop a standalone application which is used to test all 
> the senarios through JUnit framework.
> 
> The main thing in that is which out using the Application Server 
> (Websphere 5.1) and with out touching the existing code.
> 
> Our objective is, we need to create a Datasource with jndi in the same 
> way how we are doing in the j2ee application.
> 
> Some how we created the datasource and binded to the local jvm where 
> JUnit testcase is running.
> 
> But while running the application, we are getting the exception Naming 
> service is not available or J2EE client or J2EE Server environment is 
> not available.
> 
> If you have any idea, could you show some light on this problem.
> 
> Advance thanks. your ideas are welcome.

If you want to substitute the DataSource object from JNDI in your tests, 
use the package MockEJB (search the web) and a class called MockContext, 
which allows you to bind any object you want to a JNDI name without 
having to change the production code that uses JNDI.

If you want to run your JUnit tests in a server-side environment, use 
Cactus. Search the web and buy the book _JUnit in Action_.
